headline: How to use your voice to ease stress and calm down
description: Humming can have positive effects on the part of the brain that controls mood, anxiety, cognition and memory. Follow these exercises to use your voice to relax.

headline: How Much Does America Spend?
label: https://www.nytimes.com/briefing/
description: We explore what federal government spends its money on.

headline: The Generational Legacy of Samples in Music
description: No description available

headline: See which cocktails and wines could get pricier if Trump adds tariffs
description: Americans who like to drink alcohol from Europe will have to spend lot more to indulge if the Trump administration makes good on its tariff threats.

headline: DOGE fires nearly all staff at U.S. Institute of Peace headquarters
description: D.C. employees of the institute, founded and funded by Congress, received late-night termination notices, though most of its overseas staff were left in place.

headline: Where Was Each Member of the Signal Group Chat?

description: Officials were crisscrossing the world as they sent and received sensitive messages on Signal about an imminent U.S. attack on Yemen.

headline: What We Know About Cuts to the Federal Work Force
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Here are the layoffs, buyouts taken and planned reductions, by agency, that The New York Times has confirmed.

headline: Final Cuts Will Eliminate U.S. Aid Agency in All but Name
label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/
description: The staff of U.S.A.I.D. will be reduced to some 15 legally required positions. The agency employed about 10,000 people before the Trump administration entered office.

headline: Trump uses power and police to help DOGE access independent agencies
description: Trump officials have turned to law enforcement officers to help the U.S. DOGE Service led by Elon Musk gain control of independent agencies.

headline: Russia’s Reach
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: President Trump’s disdain for protecting European allies gives Vladimir Putin a fresh opportunity to extend his influence.

headline: The DOGE Playbook Targeting Federal Agencies
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The cost-cutting strategy of the group, led by billionaire Elon Musk, has played out at more than 30 agencies so far.

headline: Las deportaciones no han aumentado con Trump, pero así es como han cambiado
label: https://www.nytimes.com/es/
description: Según una revisión de The New York Times, desde que Trump asumió el cargo se han realizado 258 vuelos de deportación, el nivel alcanzado en los últimos meses del gobierno de Biden.

headline: See all the tariffs Trump has enacted, threatened and canceled
description: Get a day-by-day look at how Trump’s trade war has unfolded and where it stands now.

headline: 1 in 8 Californians now face extreme fire danger, Post analysis shows
description: One in 8 Californians now live in places at risk for the kinds of devastating wildfires that tore through Los Angeles this winter, according to a Washington Post analysis of new state fire maps.

headline: Sneeze smarter, not louder: The science of a quieter sneeze
description: At a certain point, there’s no stopping a sneeze. But doctors say there are ways to turn down the volume of an “achoo.”

headline: Health benefits company co-founded by Dr. Oz could be a conflict of interest
description: Trump’s nominee to lead the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services is entangled in another potential conflict of interest in the health-care space, ethics experts, lawyers and health care analysts say,

headline: ‘Don’t Think, Just Solve’
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Max Park is a longtime speedcubing world record holder — for the 3x3x3 cube, his best official time is 3.13 seconds. Let's show you how he does it.

headline: The Online Casinos That Can Operate as Long as They Say They Aren’t Actually Casinos
label: https://www.nytimes.com/upshot/
description: Policing loopholes in gambling law can be challenging, and most states have been slow to adapt.

headline: Greenland is hard to defend. As Trump threatens, the Danes are trying.
description: “One way or the other,” President Donald Trump told Congress, the United States needs to “get” Greenland, strategically located and rich in rare metals.

headline: The Scammer’s Manual: How to Launder Money and Get Away With It
label: https://www.nytimes.com/world/
description: Documents and insiders reveal how one of the world’s major money laundering networks operates.

headline: Deportations Haven’t Surged Under Trump. But Here’s How They’ve Changed.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: An analysis of flight data shows how the Trump administration is using extraordinary means to deport people.

headline: A Lunar Lander’s Busy Day: Eclipse Photos and Rock Collecting
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The sun has set on the Blue Ghost spacecraft, ending a successful mission to the moon.

headline: Why are there so many live-action remakes?
description: The live-action remake of Disney’s Snow White, starring Rachel Zegler and Gal Gadot, hits theaters Friday. The film is the latest in a steady stream of remakes of original films into modernized “live-action” — though still special-effect dependent — versions. This trend isn’t new; Disney's 101 Dalmatians remake was released in 1996. Since the release of the live-action Cinderella in 2015, the uptick has been palpable. Ten films were released in as many years, five in 2019 alone.

headline: Airlines Scramble to Rebook Travelers After Canceling Heathrow Flights
label: https://www.nytimes.com/business/
description: About 80 airlines operate at the airport, London’s busiest travel hub.

headline: D.C.’s BLM street painting is nearly gone. What about all the others?
description: Although D.C.’s iconic Black Lives Matter Plaza is being torn up, other street art from the summer of 2020 remains, and a few paintings look better than ever.

headline: Transfers rule March Madness. See how your team’s roster compares.
description: The Post analyzed the careers of 10,000 college basketball players to see how transfers are increasingly shaping the sport.

headline: What we can learn from watching reality stars apologize
description: No description available

headline: Judge denies request by U.S. Institute of Peace to stop DOGE takeover
description: A USIP lawsuit filed in D.C. requested a temporary restraining order and named Trump, several members of his Cabinet and DOGE representatives as defendants.

headline: DOGE plays hardball in U.S. Institute of Peace takeover
description: DOGE, which stands for Department of Government Efficiency, took over the  U.S. Institute of Peace after threatening its officials with criminal prosecution.

headline: Edison’s Power Lines Were Under Strain 14 Hours Before Eaton Fire
label: https://www.nytimes.com/business/
description: New data suggests there were faults on Southern California Edison’s transmission lines early on Jan. 7 before the fire started that evening.

headline: Un juez ordenó que los aviones de deportación regresaran. La Casa Blanca no hizo caso
label: https://www.nytimes.com/es/

headline: A Judge Ordered Deportation Planes to Turn Around. The White House Didn’t Listen.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/
description: A New York Times review of flight data showed that at the time of a federal judge’s order, two flights were in the air, and one had not yet taken off.

headline: Introducing a New Project to Track Polls
label: https://www.nytimes.com/polls/
description: The Times will aggregate public opinion surveys and produce new polling averages, starting with polls that ask about President Trump’s job performance. And we will make the data available to everyone.

label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: A maneuver so wonky that it might be best explained with sports cars and anime streaming.

headline: Deportation flights landed after judge said planes should turn around
description: Flight records reviewed by The Washington Post show that three flights bound for El Salvador arrived after a judge barred deportations under the Alien Enemies Act.

headline: How A.I. Is Changing the Way the World Builds Computers
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/

headline: Trump’s new Secret Service boss faces calls for agency overhaul
description: Sean Curran, the Secret Service’s new director, has guarded Trump for several years. He took over leadership of the protective agency on Jan. 20.

headline: What went wrong the night Altadena burned
description: A Washington Post analysis shows that some officials knew of the fire’s westward spread hours before evacuation orders were sent to residents in western Altadena.

description: Nearly 8 million Americans work in industries targeted by the levies and the majority are Trump voters, a New York Times analysis shows

headline: Trump visits Justice Department for speech that breaks all norms

headline: Draft List for New Travel Ban Proposes Trump Target 43 Countries

description: The Senate voted to advance a bill to fund the federal government through September and avoid a shutdown on Saturday.

headline: Trump wants Guantánamo to hold 30,000 migrants. So far it has held about 300.
description: Trump’s plan to vastly expand migrant detentions at the Guantánamo Bay Naval Station in Cuba has proven costly and logistically complicated.

headline: North vs South India: What is delimitation and why is it controversial
description: Southern Indian states fear losing their strength and power in the parliament if constituencies are reallocated based on updated population census.

headline: How Education Department layoffs hit student loans, testing, civil rights
description: The layoffs call into question how agency will be able to handle major operations such as student loans, FAFSA, the Nation’s Report Card and civil rights complaints.

headline: Dr. Oz goes to Washington
description: Mehmet Oz has made a successful career on TV and online, promoting often unproven weight loss treatments and supplements. Now the physician is poised to run two of America’s largest health care programs.

headline: Stocks Tumble Into Correction as Investors Sour on Trump
label: https://www.nytimes.com/business/
description: The S&P 500 is now more than 10 percent below its last record high — a line in the sand for investors worried about a sell-off gathering steam.

headline: Trump's Tariffs Are Hitting Critical Goods That Contribute to the US Trade Deficit
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: Trump wants to reduce the $1.2 trillion trade deficit, so he's putting tariffs on popular imported goods from smartphones to household appliances.

headline: Five years since the pandemic began, covid may now be endemic, experts say
description: The pandemic may be over, but the endemic disease is still a threat, especially for older adults and those with certain risk factors.

headline: Where to see cherry blossoms in the D.C. area, mapped
description: These maps show some of the best places to see cherry blossoms in Washington D.C., Maryland and Virginia.

headline: What happened the last time Trump imposed tariffs on steel and aluminum
description: A look at the 2018 tariffs on metals and what they can tell us about this round.

headline: Appeals court explains why it concluded Trump may fire Dellinger

headline: 15 Lessons Scientists Learned About Us When the World Stood Still
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The pandemic gave researchers a rare opportunity to study human behavior. Their work offers lessons about loneliness, remote work, high heels and more.

headline: Visualizing Ukraine’s military aid after the U.S. freeze
description: Since 2022, the United States has allocated more than $120 billion in aid to Ukraine. European nations have collectively allocated over $140 billion.

headline: How many goals Alex Ovechkin needs to break Wayne Gretzky’s NHL record
description: Capitals star Alex Ovechkin is closing in on Wayne Gretzky’s mark of 894. Amid his pursuit, here’s a closer look at his career.

headline: It’s not just the Gulf of Mexico. Why is so much of America named after foreign countries?
description: Our exhaustive search of American place names discovered that one country has been a shockingly dominant source of inspiration. You’ll never guess which one.

label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/

headline: Head of watchdog agency ends lawsuit to stop his firing by Trump
description: Hampton Dellinger also sought to halt the firing of some probationary government employees amid the Trump administration’s workforce cuts.

headline: Fired, Then Rehired, by the Trump Administration
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Hundreds of federal workers — many of them in critical health and national security jobs — have been brought back, sometimes within days of their initial firings.

headline: A Threat on the Right to Britain’s Conservatives, as Donors Fund a Populist Rival

label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/

label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/

headline: You’ve never heard that in a presidential address to Congress before

label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/

description: The Senate confirmed Ms. McMahon to lead the Education Department by a party-line vote of 51 to 45.

headline: Here’s what could get more expensive if Trump goes through with tariffs
description: Tomatoes, T-shirts and cars are among the vast array of goods that could become pricier with new tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump.

label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: We’d like you to look at one piece of art for 10 minutes, uninterrupted.

headline: The list of 2025 Oscar winners
description: “Anora” dominated the Academy Awards, where Adrien Brody and Mikey Madison took home the top acting prizes.

headline: See how tariffs could make your next car cost thousands more

label: https://www.nytimes.com/nyregion/

headline: Judge says Trump cannot fire head of independent watchdog agency
description: The federal judge’s decision blocks Trump from removing Hampton Dellinger as head of the Office of Special Counsel and sets up a likely Supreme Court battle over the president’s powers.
